2/29/2024 The ACSRI response to the CUAD proposal, annotated

Here, the ACSRI offers insight into its definition of broad consensus—the committee does not seek a majority view, but rather a “generally unified view.” The next question for the committee then becomes whether or not there is strong opposition to the divestment objective.

The ACSRI argues throughout their response that the proposal failed the broad consensus test because “a majority vote is not broad consensus.” According to ACSRI,though a majority of Columbia College students voted in favor of divestment based on results from a 2020 referendum, they may not be representative of the broader University opinion, including living alumni and faculty and students from other schools at the University.

Source: Spectator reporting, ACSRI proposals

Graphics by Ava Fung
